yes they were fools to remove my ability to adjust gamma, i want it brighter. i don't want to use torches because i want monsters to spawn. i like to farm while i mine now i can't do that. i can't go ANYWHERE underground without torches
å¦‚æœ Bedrock Edition åˆ é™¤äº† PDB æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆ Java Edition ä¹Ÿåº”è¯¥åˆ é™¤ MCP æ–‡ä»¶

Yes, this feature was very useful for decoration and I highly hope that this feature returns, plus, it was the one bedrock-exclusive design feature, and its removal just lowers down the bedrock edition even more than it already was.

I just go into Minecraft and buttons and levers on fences/walls were a design feature I used a lot but now that's it's gone this has hurt my creativity and desire to play the game. It didn't break anything or hurt anything so it needs to be brought back. Sadly untill this has been reverted I don't think I can continue with Minecraft.

I would also like to add to this, my boyfriend who after years of request just recently started playing.

He is more of a builder and created somthing using buttons placed on fences and walls, he was proud of this idea and as you mentioned has too used this in a lot of his builds.

As a result if this change, and being unable to finish somthing he was working on, he has lost a lot of intrest in the game. He currently finds himself not wanting to play, as of frustration caused by each attempt to place a button for the purpose of adding detail and intrest to his builds.

Adding details and intrest is a lot of what minecraft is about. More so for those we would call a builder. Having an aspect a game cause frustration in place of joy as I'm sure you would agree is not going to be a good thing for all those that exsperience it.

generally i dont mind changes to mechanics in minecraft but buttons are a key decoration feature. im currently buildimg a bridge and wanted to add buttons to give it more oomf, more drama, and i cant. its kind of infuriating, and it limits what we can do with our builds.

I think this needs to be put back into the game immediately because I used it a lot for decorative items like making walls look a little bit taller on the sides using string. That's just no. It doesn't look good enough and then you have this terrible hitbox and white crap on your screen. I'm not good with comments but all I know is it was a very bad choice to take that out. Now if it's a bug please fix it. It was a very very good decorative item. Thank you
I too have lost interest in doing it and haven't played it once since the update was done.Please help me spread the word to get this opinion to management.

I just found out the hard way (breaking a button and not being able to replace it) that this doesn't work anymore. It's a small detail but it adds a lot when you want nicer looking railings. I had always thought it was a feature--I hope it gets put back, like the floating candles were

I think itâ€™s generally a bad game design principle for Minecraft to have something to be placeable on something else and then revoke that in an update.

Even worse, the buttons have started disappearing on stuff I made a long time ago and there is no good replacement option.

I started building a music studio which was supposed to have little microphones in it which I have historically made by placing a black stone button on an iron bar, which no longer works, not to mention all previous mics in the world are now just one iron bar with no button.

Retroactively breaking parts of peopleâ€™s builds to fix something that wasnâ€™t even a proper bug is incredibly irritating and bad game design. I love this game, but I find myself perplexed by its developers frequently. Please fix this so I can fix my old builds and make more new ones with this technique.

The removal makes no sense, MC is a place where you can use your creativity with very few limitations, but this is ridicolous, today I wanted to keep working on my FNaF pizzeria with a new light system, powered by buttons on fences, and when I pressed it it broke. I think this "fix" should be reverted ASAP.

Everything is already said. I also used buttons on fences to style 1 one-block-high walls on bridges and next to paths. I just realized the problem today building a new bridge next to an existing one. Removing this feature broke many existing worlds of players! Something Mojang promised to avoid! So please bring back this function!

I have to agree, the removal of this feature has really dampened my enthusiasm to finish the builds I'm working on. I had hoped it was a bug from the new update, but so far it hasn't been fixed. I really hope this wasn't a purposeful removal and rather unintended. Regardless a lot of my builds will remain unfinished until this feature is reinstated.
Who had the idea to â€œfixâ€ this? Terrible change

It feels like removing the ability to place buttons on walls goes against the core of Minecraft damaging the second part of the name. It was the best way to create extra details to walls without resorting to placing string on top of them. The string itself is ugly when it can be seen whereas buttons match the texture and not only force a wall to become the end version but also add a little detail on top making it look rounded and more natural. I have used this feature in nearly every wall I've made and it is also incredibly useful for building details statues of many varieties. Which I have enjoyed creating a lot of for spooky environments and are now all broken.  This feature could not be used as an exploit did not break any gameplay and only added to the creativity and enjoyment of the game so it's removal is only harmful to the Bedrock player base.

Had several builds that concretely relied on this feature, and it was removed for the sake of parity apparently. Terrible change, terrible terrible change, really hope they change it back as this combined with many other stupid parity changes for bedrock has removed a lot of my interest in the game. Mojang needs to do better, smh
Whoever had the idea to remove this feature should be either fired or sent to a mental hospital.

I just now too discovered this removal of this feature and I am shocked! I already realized I couldn't add buttons or levers I never knew it was a thing at all when I actually started building! THANK GOD! But this hampers creative intentions without adding a mod to do it. I do it all vanilla in my megabuild. This is somthing I do not like to see happening in the community, damaging creativity!

Please revert this change. It has completely ruined a city build I had been working on for months. If it wasn't causing any problems, why change it? This has completely killed my motivation to continue playing. I invested so much time into my build and now an update, that should fix issues, has caused a game breaking issue as far as I'm concerned.

Been almost a year and still no fix. I hardly ever have fences without buttons on them, they just look better. Now every build that has the buttons, if I accidentally click it it will breakâ€¦.. I canâ€™t stand it when things arenâ€™t ordered and symmetrical so itâ€™s basically ruined all my builds xD

I don't know why but it just hurts, minecraft intentionally removed that "bug" knowing full well that many players liked this so called "bug" for a creative opinion for decorating, and still removed it for some reason. Just makes me feel like they didn't care about what the community might think. It was a bug that didn't hurt the game or anything in it, there was no need to make this change and yet the did. I've been feeling this for a while, minecraft is changing but not for the better; and it hurts. It feels like there just in it for the money trying to ride the original success of the original idea of the game. Kind of like Disney right now. I hope im wrong, because I like the new blocks they add all the time. Key word though, "new".

@Mojang; any thoughts on when getting this much wanted feature?
Plz bring back hardcore I never played it before but I see other people who played it and I want to play it toğŸ‘

The JAVA version has had the mode "Hardcore" for a long time, and until now, no one has demanded to migrate the function to the BEDROCK version, many players looking for challenges want this function available, after all, mobile today is played a lot not only by the children's audience, but by many old players who are now young adults

I want this feature so badly because I want to have a fresh next gen experience and fresh trophies to earn. I am sure a next gen upgrade will happen eventually, but 2 years is max for me considering it can't take over 2 years. I am sure it's all coronas fault because then their will be miner issues. I bet this will come in mid 2022 or late 2021 or be announced on minecraft festival event. I just want this mojang very soon. I am sure that mojang are working on it, but at least do not disappoint us. You must make it, mojang has no excuses to make it. Please don't let us down mojang. That would make my day,  more and more exciting and I will get hyped. Please mojang.

hey, well get there.

one. vote. at. a. time!

hopefully people in 2024 are going, Omg they got that upgrade ages ago!
Nama reksa boleh masuk ke gem ya
Would love a proper PS5 version as well. Surprising that there isn't even a series x version considering it's Microsofts console.
I really want to try the new Rtx feature in Minecraft on my Ps5
It should have crossplay because it's more fun with friends

Seriously why isn't this a thing? My 2018 laptop can run the game at 75 chunk render distance while my PS5 struggles to run at 24? We NEED a PS5 upgrade and/or for Mojang to stop supporting the PS4 version, because that 2013 hardware is holding the game back
2024 and still no PS5 version and raytracing ğŸ˜
An updated version would make the game so fresh again, it would be even better if haptic feedback was added to make Minecraft even more immersive.
They could add rumble for things like splashing into water and sound on the controller for when you take damage.
yall need to release the PS5 version with Ray Tracing to get a more emersive experience.
Yes, offhand would be so great. I mostly play bedrock because rtx and overall better performance, but thats just such an advantage in java edition!
This would be useful I've seen it in building and it could also be useful in pvp
please add off hand in minecraft bedrock please please please pleaseğŸ™ğŸ»ğŸ™ğŸ»ğŸ™ğŸ»ğŸ™ğŸ»ğŸ™ğŸ»ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­
Please add this feature so the no. Of players are play minecraft in soon
This could ne soo helpful especially for pvp

For real though I've always wanted to make a survival world that I could customize since I really like the warm ocean but hate desert why not make a tropical island with my favorite boimes on different islands surrounding it
Es soll ein neuer Knopf geben mit dem man Strukturen von seiner eigenen Welt die man gebaut hat kopieren kann und in andere Welten einfÃ¼gen kann die Struktur soll beim Knopf gespeichert sein
yes we need this making a map by only placing blocks is insanely hard
yeah but can it be placed too on playstation 4 and 5.
I want peanuts, tree nuts, more fruits, vegetables, and maybe even more trees such as the banana tree and palmetto (palm tree).

I do think it has a great idea to add more crops. However there comes the task of having to put those crops into use. The idea is really nice but what exactly would we implement with adding more crops. Plain Jane more crops, I think would give the same feeling as what we have now. Like it could be better. I think if we were to add more crops adding more recipes and unique qualities into them. Would make a small part of this game a little bit more entertaining.

I think the following field crops might be a good addition:

rice, tomatos, peppers, cabbage, kale, cauliflower, broccoli, sweetpotatos, onions and so on.

On the berry side of things I'd love to see the following:

strawberrys, blueberrys, blackberrys, raspberrys , currants and so on.

I'd also love to see some real crop trees for:

appels, pairs, peaches, plums, oranges, coconuts, bananas and so on.
I like it because its new biom and great
